column4: A Uniform Resource Locator that is a multi-purpose persistent identifier for information objects of any type.

A globally unique Credential Transparency Identifier issued by the Credential Registry Service by which the creator/owner/provider of a credential recognizes the credential in transactions with the external environment.
A persistent identifier or handle used to uniquely identify objects, standardized by the ISO.
An identifier for information assets that have identifiers in public namespaces but are not part of the URI allocation.
A string of characters used to identify a resource.
A Uniform Resource Locator, commonly informally termed a web address is a reference to a web resource that specifies its location on a computer network and a mechanism for retrieving it.
A string of characters used to identify a name of a web resource.
128-bit number used to identify information in computer systems.
